data.title: Automation Race - Self Organisation of Business Actors

paragraphs.context: Intelligent Telematics, the leading provider of connected vehicle camera solutions, has relocated its European headquarters to Reading as part of an ambitious expansion strategy that will see its workforce more than double in the coming months. The company has officially opened the office development as Commerce Park in Theale following annual revenue growth of 67  percent driven by unprecendented demand for its connected vehicle camera portfolio from the road transport, fleet and insurance sectors.

qas.question: What size  have Intelligent Telematics grown by?
Where did Intelligent Telematics move to?

paragraphs.context: Focus operations will be phased out of Michigan from mid-2018 and relocated to the Chongqing plant in China. Ford's president of global operations confirmed the company would inform the White House this morning. By importing its small Ford Focus car from China in 2019, Ford Motor Company plans to save up to $1 billion (897 million euro), including $500 billion from the decision to cancel plans for a brand new plant in Mexico.

qas.question: What will be phased out of Michigan?
Where are Focus operations relocated to?
Where did Focus operations move from?

paragraphs.context: Guident, a software developer for remote monitoring and teleoperation of autonomous vehicles, will relocate from Florida Atlantic University's Tech Runway to a 5,000-square foot office at the innovation campus. The company reports the space will be home to the first national autonomous vehicle remote control command center.

qas.question: Who does remote monitoring?

paragraphs.context: Mobile technology company Aptiv has reported its fourth-quarter financial results, which expectedly were mired by General Motors' labor strike bt the United Automobile Workers (UAW). This situation, which played out in October, led to considerable losses for Aptiv as it is a vital parts supplier to GM and holds a significant stake in the automaker's autonomous vehicle program.

With a fleet of Jaguar I-Pace vehicles, Wayve plans to expand beyond London as it has tested its technology in five other cities in the UK. Artificial intelligence expert Amar Shah founded the company alongside Alex Kendall in London in 2017. Shah led the firm as its CEO until 2020.

qas.question: Who planned to create jobs?
Who led the firm?
How many cities will Wayve extend to?

paragraphs.context: Ocado has announced plans to create 100 new advanced technology jobs in the UK as part of an expansion of its Swiftfields Campus development centre in Welwyn Garden City, Herefordshire.

qas.question: How many jobs will be created?
What is in Welwyn Garden City?
Where are the jobs located?

paragraphs.context: The pre-series, funding will be used to scale-up production of its electric AV technology, which will facilitate opportunities for retail investors to directly benefit from the company's growth and accelerated expansion. This includes Academy of Robotics opening a new factory and test-track facility in a rural location in the East of England, which will create at least 100 new jobs by 2023, including skilled work and technological development opportunities.

The pre-series,  funding will be used to scale-up production of its electric AV technology, which will facilitate opportunities for retail investors to directly benefit from the company's growth and accelerated expansion. This includes Academy of Robotics opening a new factory and test-track facility in a rural location in the East of England, which will create at least 100 new jobs by 2023, including skilled work and technological development opportunities.

qas.question: Who will benefit from these opportunities?

paragraphs.context: Bosch is acquiring Five, described as 'Europe's leading startup in the field of automated driving'. At six locations in the United Kingdom, its roughly 140 associates are working on self-driving vehicles. Five gave preference to Bosch over other takeover bidders, Bosch said. The startup now focuses primarily on a cloud-based development and testing platform for the software used in self-driving cars. At Bosch, Five will strengthen the company's project structure for the development of self-driving cars. The two teams' software engineering environments will be merged to form a single solution.

qas.question: Who is acquiring Five?

paragraphs.context: The Department for Business said new grants would help get self-driving buses, delivery vans, shuttles and 'pods' on UK roads from 2025. The ministry says this will deliver 'convenience for consumers and making journeys safer, greener and more reliable'. Ministers hope it will also boost the economy by £42 billion and create 38,000 jobs by 2035. Mike Hawes of the Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders said: 'The UK is rightly seeking to be at the forefront of this technological evolution. Today's announcement is a significant step'.

qas.question: What do ministers hope this will boost?
How many jobs will the new grants create?

paragraphs.context: Driverless vehicle company Wayve - which is carrying out autonomous grocery delivery van trials for Ocado and Asda this year - has raised $200m (£147m) in its latest funding round. The round is a significant cash injection for the London-based startup, founded in 2017, which had previously raised $58m. Wayve's tech - which it calls AV2.0 - combines "a lean, camera-first sensing suite" with an end-to-end deep learning system that continually adapts to the "petabytescale driving data" provided by the company's partner fleets. Eclipse Ventures, a long-time supporter of Wayve, led the latest round with participation from new global financial investors including D1 Capital Partners, Baillie Gifford, Moore Strategic Ventures and Linse Capital. There was also additional support from Microsoft and Virgin, and early-stage investors Compound and Balderton Capital.

qas.question: Which company  is carrying out autonomous grocery delivery?
Which company has an end-to-end deep learning system?
Who are the early-stage investors in Wayve?

paragraphs.context: Addnode Group today announces that it has acquired British company Claytex Services Limited (Claytex). Claytex specializes in advanced simulation and virtual testing, with focus on systems engineering and autonomous vehicles in the automotive and motorsport space. A Dassault Systèmes partner, Claytex has also developed a complimentary portfolio of proprietary software which is marketed directly and through partners.

qas.question: Who aquired Claytex Services?
Who has developed a portfolio?
What kind of portfolio does Claytex own?

paragraphs.context: A major trial of driverless cars will begin on the roads of Milton Keynes later this month - and people can order a ride through an app. If the trials are successful, the service will run at Milton Keynes train station and be offered as a paid alternative to commuters. The Fetch car system is backed by the government and Milton Keynes Council and the goal is to make remote driving safer than actual driving. The tiny vehicles will not be autonomous and a human will control each one remotely from a control centre. People can order a ride by using a special app and the car will then be delivered to them. Already the vehicles have been tested out on private land and car parks around MK Stadium, and one of the first official journeys was to take MK Dons footballers in to work. MK Dons players and staff will also be taking part in the trials. Imperium Drive, the company behind the trials, says a “safety driver” will be in every vehicle in the initial stages of the trial. But eventually the cars will go alone, with computer image algorithms to detect anything that is nearby. Imperium chief executive Koosha Kaveh said: “There’s still a human involved, but they’ll be sitting in a control centre controlling the vehicle in the same way you would control a drone.” The head of transport innovation at Milton Keynes Council, Brian Matthews, said driverless cars will be commonplace in Milton Keynes within two years

qas.question: Where will the major trial of driverless cars begin?
What is the fetch car system?

answers.text: to make remote driving safer than actual driving

qas.question: Where were the driverless cars tested?

answers.text: the vehicles have been tested out on private land and car parks around MK Stadium

qas.question: What algorithms will be used to detect near objects?

answers.text: computer image algorithms to detect anything that is nearby

qas.question: Who is the chief executive of Imperium?
Who is involved at the control centre of these driverless cars?

answers.text: a human involved, but they’ll be sitting in a control centre controlling the vehicle in the same way you would control a drone

qas.question: When is it estimated,that driverless cars will be commanplace in Milton Keynes?
Who is the head of transport at innovation, Milton Keynes Council?

paragraphs.context: Ford Motor Company and DP World London Gateway have conducted a trial with a simulated autonomous vehicle to demonstrate how useful such future technology could be to those managing - and employed on - large worksites. The initiative is part of Ford's Self-Driving Research Programme, designed to help businesses understand how autonomous vehicles could benefit their operations. The underlying intention behind the pilot programme is to identify new opportunities and models for autonomous vehicle operations - in particular understanding how existing processes and human interactions can work alongside automated vehicles

qas.question: Who conducted trials on simulation of autonomous vehicles?

answers.text: Ford Motor Company and DP World London Gateway

qas.question: What does Fords Self-driving research progamme entail?

answers.text: designed to help businesses understand how autonomous vehicles could benefit their operations.

qas.question: Who has conducted a trial in autonomous vehicles?

answers.text: Ford Motor Company and DP World London Gateway

qas.question: What did this trial demonstrate?

answers.text: demonstrate how useful such future technology could be to those managing - and employed on - large worksites

qas.question: What is Ford's Self-Driving Research programme about?

answers.text: designed to help businesses understand how autonomous vehicles could benefit their operations.

qas.question: What is the underlying intention behind the programme?

answers.text: o identify new opportunities and models for autonomous vehicle operations - in particular understanding how existing processes and human interactions can work alongside automated vehicles

paragraphs.context: By a News Reporter-Staff News Editor at Journal of Engineering -- Investigators publish new report on Machine Learning. According to news reporting originating in Southampton, United Kingdom, by VerticalNews journalists, research stated, "Connected Vehicles and Autonomous Vehicles (CAVs) provide various sources of vehicular related information to intersection infrastructure by integrating on-board sensors processing, wireless communication and other Vehicle-to-Infrastructure (V2I) technologies. Thus connected vehicle technologies can potentially remedy data collection limitations of existing urban intersection managements, enhancing the performances of intersection controls such as reducing vehicle delay, reducing vehicle number of stops and improving energy efficiency."

qas.question: Who published a new report on machine learning?

answers.text: a News Reporter-Staff News Editor at Journal of Engineering

qas.question: Which journal discussed a report on Machine Learning?

answers.text: By a News Reporter-Staff News Editor at Journal of Engineering

qas.question: Which news reporter stated ' connected vehicles and Autonomous vehicles provide various sources of vehicular related information'?

answers.text: By a News Reporter-Staff News Editor at Journal of Engineering

paragraphs.context: A new Clever Cars study from Confused.com looked at today’s connected cars and their infotainment subscriptions to find who provides the best services for the lowest fee. Lexus comes out on top for its inexpensive connected car features scoring five out of 10 for lowest price tier subscription costs. Audi has a high average cost price of £432 for their services for the year, with wifi, navigation and traffic information, hands-free access and music access available on the highest-price tier subscription. One of the most connected cars today, Tesla, ranked below the likes of Land Rover and Jaguar, with an average yearly subscription cost of just £119.98.

qas.question: Which car scored the highest  in the study?
Whihc car scored the lowest in the study?

paragraphs.context: Computer scientists from Lancaster University have developed new AI technology that takes autonomous cars a step closer to our roads.Funded by global car manufacturer Ford, the three-year research project provides a step-change in AI car technology by enabling autonomous cars to recognise new and unexpected situations. Around the world, many different automotive brands, computing companies, and research teams, are developing autonomous car technologies and many of these are using a machine learning technique called 'Deep Learning'. (18 Dec 2021)

qas.question: Which university developed new AI technology that can take autonomous cars a step closer to our roads?

paragraphs.context: PLANS for a brave new world where autonomous cars and trucks operate independently suffered another setback after the driver of a Tesla on autopilot was charged with two counts of vehicular manslaughter. The vehicle ran a red light, slammed into another car and killed two people in California in 2019. The defendant is understood to be the first person to be charged over a fatal crash involving a vehicle operating an automated driving system.There goes any hope of having a new generation of smart cars to take us home from the pub after having a few pints without having to get behind the wheel. (Unexpected Events)

qas.question: Who suffered a setback?
How many setbacks were there?

answers.text: another setback after the driver of a Tesla on autopilot was charged with two counts of vehicular manslaughter.

qas.question: Which autonomous car rn a red light?
When did this happen?

paragraphs.context: Musk has reportedly promised that Tesla cars would reach full self-driving "next year" every single year since 2014, leading some to question whether the AI-powered cars will ever really work. Tesla has received a number of criticisms over the safety of its 'Autopilot' software, which allows certain car functions such as steering or lane changes to be operated by an AI.

qas.question: What did Musk report?

answers.text: Musk has reportedly promised that Tesla cars would reach full self-driving "next year" every single year since 2014

qas.question: Who was criticised over safety?

answers.text: esla has received a number of criticisms over the safety of its 'Autopilot' software,

qas.question: Who reported that Tesla would reach full sel-driving  "next year"

answers.text: Musk has reportedly promised that Tesla cars would reach full self-driving "next year" every single year since 2014

The new Centre of Excellence (CoE) will be part of the Mahindra Global Design Network that includes the Mahindra Design Studio in Mumbai, India, and Pininfarina Design in Turin, Italy.
